intro: Cyphia elata f. truncata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Cyphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
